definition: to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: But many school-age children have not been tested.
sentences.chinese: 但許多適齡兒童沒有受到考驗。

sentences.english: The law should be to the local secondary school age children.
sentences.chinese: 法律規定適齡兒童應當到當地中學就讀。

sentences.english: There was also a large increase in Internet use among school-aged children and college students.
sentences.chinese: 適齡兒童和大學生之間在互聯網的使用也有大幅增加。

sentences.english: Below are recommendation of such battery powered ride on toys for elementary-age kids.
sentences.chinese: 下面是這種電池的建議對小學適齡兒童玩具本站乘坐。

sentences.english: Universal education means85percent school-aged children could receive ninew-year universal education.
sentences.chinese: 普九，即爲85%適齡兒童能夠接受到九年義務教育。

sentences.english: In addition, the school-age children are able to according to the agreed rules of the game.
sentences.chinese: 此外，適齡兒童都能夠按照約定的遊戲規則。

sentences.english: What about all the books he had read and outgrown?
sentences.chinese: 捐出那些他已經讀過並且不再適齡的書如何？

definition: a couple where both spouses are not Hong Kong citizens
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
